comments.text: The nsIDeviceContext printing methods (Begin/EndDocument, Begin/EndPage, etc) are thin wrappers around nsIDeviceContextSpec methods and similar methods on a printing surface.  It would be simpler and tidier if the printing code dealt directly in nsIDeviceContextSpec objects -- also this would eliminate a few messes where we have to be careful to figure out whether we've got a screen devctx or a printing devctx.
